reviewText: Kylie Minogue is by far the U.K's bigggest and best tour showgirl - up there with Madonna, of course. And so she brings you Showgirl - her All The Feathers tour, in which Kylie performs over twenty-five of her greats. Classics like Better The Devil You Know, Especially For You, Love At First Sight, I Believe In You, Kylie's most recent hit single Giving You Up - and who can forget Can't Get You Out Of My Head? - are included. There's also Kylie's most recent U.K number one - Slow, and The Loco-Motion, Kylie's biggest hit here in the U.S.Also included is a FANTASTIC twenty minute documentary - Behind The Feathers - in which this takes you behind the scenes, and even into Kylie's dressing room! ;) There's also video projections in their full, which are really fun to watch! There's also an enhanced ROM section, and the twelve-page booklet with stunning never-before-seen pictures, makes this release SO WORTH WHILE. *GET WELL SOON, KYLIE*

Title: N/A

reviewText: Kylie's  ultimate concert is a must have for all music lovers. Stylish backdrops, stunning costumes and eye-catching dancers provide a feast for the eyes, nearly distracting viewers from the lady herself.24 of her most loved singles from PWL, deconstruction and Parlapone, plus what is probably most fans favourite non-single track `Dreams'. And, in case this isn't enough, there are also covers of Judy Garland's immortal classic `Over The Rainbow', and what was originally a duet with The Pet Shop Boys; `In Denial'.I was lucky enough to go to 2 shows, and I admit I was surprised by the strength of her voice - she really can hit the high notes. Just wait to you hear `Confide In Me' and `Over The Rainbow'.I have to admit my favourites were the classic PWL hits, all our favourites are here: `Better The Devil You Know', `Shocked', `What Do I Have To Do', `Je Ne Sais Pas Pourquoi', `Hand On Your Heart', `Locomotion', `I Should Be So Lucky' and `Especially For You'.Another stand out number is `I Believe In You'; it really took my breath away - just superb! `Come Into My World', `Put Yourself In My Place', `Chocolate' and `On A Night Like This' are all hauntingly beautiful.Then there's Kylie's current, and most popular Parlapone sound. `In Your Eyes', `Giving You Up', `Spinning Around', `Red Blooded Woman' (Medley with `Where The Wild Roses Grow'), `Slow', `Please Stay', `Your Disco Needs You', `Can't Get You Out Of My Head' and `Love At First Sight' all passionately sung by our favourite pop princess!* And don't forget the extras: a backstage documentary, screen visuals and ROM section for your computer, so you can download screen savers and wallpapers.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A fun show with a performer who actually seems to be having fun herself.Kylie manages to squeeze in most of her big hits, and stays true to her formula of putting her dancers in the most bizarre costumes possible, engaging the audience, and just plain looking great.Well worth the price.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Its a shame that Kylie Minogue isn't as well known in the United States as she is in her native Australia or even in Europe. A few viewings of her Showgirl Greatest Hits tour could change all that. Filmed before an enthusiastic audience at London's Earls Court in May 20005, Minogue shows why she is such a fan favorite throughout the rest of the world.The Showgirl Tour presents 28 of Minogue's greatest hits and is more of a spectacle than a normal concert. Featuring lavish costumes and twelve dancers the show is always fun to watch even if its diminutive star sometimes gets lost in what's happening on the giant stage. Highlights include Better the Devil You Know, Spinning Around, Over the Rainbow and Your Disco Needs You.Pull up a chair, fix yourself your favorite beverage and indulge yourself in a night of campy pop fun. See it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay, you simply must read this review if you are considering this, or anything to do with Kylie Ann Minogue in any way. I am from the U.S.A., so Kylie is not as big here as in Europe. I have purchased many items from overseas just to hear Kylie (this was not one of them). When I first saw her in her music video "Can't get you out of my head," I was hooked. I had to get her. I went to WalMart and found 2 CD's with that song. I purchased hers (the other was a NOW CD), the "Fever" album. From there, I now have 6 CD's (not including bonus discs) and 3 DVD's from Kylie Minogue.About Showgirl: The Greatest Hits Tour. Here is the concert track listing on the back of the box and then I will tell you about the concert and the other concerts she gave:1. Overture2. Better the devil you know3. In your eyes4. Giving you up5. On a night like this6. Shocked7. What do I have to do8. Spinning around9. In denial10. Je ne sais pas pourquoi11. Confide in me12. Red Blooded Woman/Where the wild roses grow13. Slow14. Please stay15. Over the rainbow (from "The Wizard of Oz")16. Come into my world17. Chocolate18. I believe in you19. Dreams20. Hand on your heart21. The Loco-Motion22. I should be so lucky23. Your disco needs you24. Put yourself in my place25. Can't get you out of my head26. Especially for you27. Love at first sightLook, she sang 27 songs and the running time for this DVD is approx. 2 hours according to the box. DVD Extras include:1. Behind the Feathers--Backstage Documentary2. Screen Projections3. Showgirl ROM SectionKylie does sing all of those songs listed, but she has to go faster than what you would hear on a CD because of how many she had to sing. For example, "Chocolate" on the "Body Language" album is approx. 4 minutes long. However, she did a "radio edit" version found on the "Ultimate Kylie" CD, therefore it is played less than one would expect. This could be both good and bad. Good if you wish to get to the next song quicker (there are plenty to go around!) and bad if you really like the song and like watching Kylie perform it.Now, one last thing. I know some songs are missing. Let's take the song "Light Years" from the "Light Years" album. If you wish to see Kylie perform that song live, check her out in the "Live in Sydney" DVD. That one is her last concert from Australia, her home town. It was made in 2001 (Showgirl was made in 2005) and has a running time of 2 hours 7 minutes. The track listing is as follows for "Kylie: Live in Sydney":1. Love Boat2. Koocachoo3. Hand on your heart4. Put yourself in my place5. Medley: Step back in time/Never too late/Wouldn't change a thing/Turn it into love/Celebration6. Can't get you out of my head7. Your disco needs you8. I should be so lucky9. Better the devil you know10. So now goodbye11. Physical12. Butterfly13. Confide in me14. Kids15. Shocked16. Light years17. What do I have to do18. Spinning aroundDVD Extras include the following:1. Promo video for the hit single "Spinning Around"2. 5.1 Dolby Digital Surround3. Backstage footage4. Subtitles in English, French, Spanish, German, and ItalianWell, from a huge Kylie Ann Minogue fan to, hopefully, another, "Thank you for flying KM air. We hope you had a pleasant flight. Please, fly with us again" --"Light Years".
summary: A review from a huge Kylie Minogue fan!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love Kylie... but the girl just doesn't know how to put on a show. She's got some great videos (Come Into My World, Red Blooded Woman, Did it Again), and some Classic Hits.. (Can't Get You Out of My Head, Locomotion, On a Night Like This)... but she just can't do THE ULTIMATE Show...BRIEF REVIEW:-I hated the costumes.. especially the first one, that showgirl look just wasn't it for her.... loose the plumes you look like a broke-down peacock.. The costume for "SLOW" was alright. But I swear I think I saw some of the same costumes in the FEVER tour.. especially on the back up dancers in SHOCKED.-Some GREAT Performances of "I BELIEVE IN YOU" "DREAMS" "RED BLOODED WOMAN" "I SHOULD BE SO LUCKY"-Choreography Sucks, but that's nothing new for Kylie... But she actually danced during "CONFIDE IN ME" which shocked me.. and I enjoyed that part.-Poor Performances of "GIVING YOU UP" "COME INTO MY WORLD" "ON A NIGHT LIKE THIS" and "OVER THE RAINBOW"- KYLIE, better than Madonna or Cher.. knows how to make an entrance.. but just like Cher (and unlike Madonna)... Kylie doesn't know how to follow it up. She just stands there...-Some of the songs are really emotional to you... or at least to me when you sit there and think "This woman has breast cancer, and she's still out there doing it." Granted it was just before she went into treatment.. but the cancer is still there.- Costuming on the Guys is HOT, especially in RBW.-GREAT Setlist.-Sings Live, which is always a plus.. even if you don't have a great voice.. we'd rather hear what you have to offer than a lifeless show that was entirely pre-recorded. (Did you hear that Britney?)- In Some Respects it's better than FEVER.. which in my opinion was her best concert... but is other respects it's closer to an over-produced nameless anyone pop concert...-A Fun show for a Kylie Fan.. but not the casual Kylie listener... she might make an entrance.. but the overall show does not hold you like Our Lady of Concerts does.. (Madonna). So if you're just looking for a good concert.. This isn't your best pick.. but if you're a Kylie Fan, you'll love this.
summary: Gotta Love Kylie.. She Tries Real Hard

reviewText: I first ordered this DVD from amazon.com and was disappointed when it didn't ship right away. Then someone on Kylie's official forum said that Canada's cdplus website had NTSC versions in stock, I canceled my order and went through that site instead. I actually saved a lot of money ordering directly from Canada instead of buying from the US and having to pay an import cost.The show is absolutely amazing from the opening song of "Better the Devil you know" to the last song of "Love at first sight" (Fever version).Kylie has redone a lot of her songs to give them a fresh sound. There are so many highlights for me. The beginning of "On a night like this" is so beautiful-it's sounds like a  ballad and then goes into the normal dance version in the second verse. This is the first time I've ever heard Kylie sing "In Denial" and the dancer that dances through that one through "Confide in me" is amazing, I believe his name is Jason Beital(sp?). "Confide in me" is also given a makeover and it is so great. It's probably been the song that I've watched the most. Kylie and Jason perform a little dance in the middle of "Confide in me" that is one of my favorite parts of the whole show. "Over the rainbow" is of course one of the highlights and the image of Kylie on the moon is gorgeous. "Come into my world" is also perform while she's on the moon and it became a beautifil ballad. "Dreams" is finally performed in full for the first time and it's really worth wait. That is one of Kylie's most powerful songs ever and when I listened to it the day that Kylie announced she had breast cancer, I got teary-eyed.  "Hand on your heart" also got a make-over and the mix of it is really great sounding and it'll get stuck in your head-not that that's a bad thing. "Loco-motion" continues to be jazzy-sounding but it's different than any other version that she's done. I prefer the "Fever" live version better but this one is great as well. "I should be so lucky" sounds almost exactly as the 1987 version and the dancers perform it in sign language. "Especially for you" is another highlight with the audience joining in.All of the songs are great and there isn't one dull moment in the show. The "Behind the Feathers" documentry is a great highlight and it's fantastic to see some of what goes on behind the scenes. There is a small clip on there of Kylie talking about her tour family that was filmed, I believe, on May 2. This is where a member of the band, Chris Brown, proposed to his girlfriend. I kind of wished that they had shown the whole clip because it sounds like it was a really sweet moment. This DVD is a must for any Kylie fan and hopefully everyone will be able to get their copies soon. There's talk of Kylie finishing the tour in 2006 and she might slight alterations to the show so there's something to look forward to."Keep believing in dreams!"
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've seen 4 Kylie Shows.  This one makes the other 3 seem like nap time.  This show is the best tour I have ever seen.  It's flashy, but in an effortless way.  Almost like this tour was more about ideas based on what Kylie wants more than what the audience would want.  She starts out with a Moulin Rouge theme that is super flashy and glamorous.  Next was the Disco Dive section.  After that she has a Homo erotic men-together-in-the-locker-room theme that is perfect for preserving her gay appeal, (not to mention that the dancers are almost naked).  She also has some Chicago influence and then comes the Space Age Kylie.  Her singing is stronger than any of the actual tracks she has recorded.  Then there is the set itself, it's amazing.  There are many beautiful colors and pieces that go every which way.  It is very nice.  I would pick up this DVD as soon as you can.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I think it'll be hard for Kylie ever to top what she did with her Fever tour in 2002. I now some people found her too distant on that tour, the whole set-up being very mechanical, but to me it worked perfectly - there was a lot of show, yes, but it somehow managed to move the focus to the music more than anything, and her voice was absolutely amazing on the DVD from Manchester.Exactly her voice I find to be somewhat lacking at this show. Yes, she does a spectacular version of Over The Rainbow, but she doesn't go for the high notes on Je Ne Sais Pas Pourquois and Dreams, and when she does go for the high notes, like in Confide In Me, she doesn't always quite make them. Oh, it's not bad, but it's not as good as on her previous show. Her voice is often quite week and thin, and she's drowned in the three backing singers on occasion. One cannot keep from having a ghastly feeling that this might have something to do with her cancer, diagnosed just a week after this show, but it might also just be it was not her best night.Still, credit has to be given where it's due. The show is AMAZING. The stage set-up for Red Blooded Woman is unlike anything that's ever seen before, and this show is well worth getting to see this alone, if you're a fan at least and didn't make it to the show. Of course that's only one of many highlights - I love the weird costumes of the Smiley-Kiley medley (Do You Dare? / Shocked / What Do I Have To Do / Spinning Around / Step Back In Time), the solo dancer performing through In Denial and Je Ne Sais Pas Pourquois is excellent, the stage set-up for I Believe In You is beautiful, and the choreography for Your Disco Needs You is right on the spot. Perhaps the only thing that didn't work so well for me was the feather part of the 'Showgirl' opening set, can't really say why, but it wasn't as stunning as the rest of the show.About her crew, one has to say that she's collected a group of extremely hot and at the same time very skilled dancers. Obviously the male dancers is a direct nod to her growing gay audience. The band is solid and competent and really doesn't get a lot of credit in this filming - most of the members only get one short camera shot - if any - during the two-hour show!The set-list is great - she manages to cover everything from earliest to most recent, virtually all the great hits and several less known fan favorites as well. The performance of 'Dreams' is a huge favour to all her dedicated fans, who have wished for this song to enter the live set for years. Also, the way the show is arranged into 7 subsets - 'Showgirl', 'Smiley-Kiley', 'Denial', 'What Kylie Wants, Kylie Gets', 'Dreams', 'Kylesque' and 'Minx In Space' is BRILLIANT - the songs in each set has some sort of connection through theme, sound or lyrics, and like on the Fever tour, this makes the whole two-hour show seem very structured and with a red line connecting it all from beginning to end.The sound and picture of this release is excellent. They've re-edited the show for DVD to make some distinction from the TV-recorded bootlegs; in reality the difference is minor, but ofcourse picture, mix and especially sound is better on the official release.All in all I have to say that even if this is not Kylies best show, it's a must have for dedicated fan as well as casual listener. Do not miss the Fever Manchester 2002 DVD, though, and the Sydney 2001 DVD is a great concert as well.OVERALL GRATE: 9 out of 10.
summary: Not her best show - but still essential for fan or newcomer.

reviewText: This is one of Kylie Minogue's best concert DVDs; superb showmanship and energy throughout.  High energy tracks and a fun concert to watch - glad I got this one.  I just wish I'd heard about Kylie years ago, I just started watching her concerts recently; this one is one of her best (her Manchester and Sydney concert dvds are excellent as well).Update: Dec 2011.. A year after I bought this, I like it now even more than ever; I watch some songs from it at least a couple of times a month, it's outstanding.  One of my favorite concert DVDs, fresh, energetic, good choreography and plenty of enthusiasm and style. Definitely a winner!-k
summary: Outstanding concert - super staging, musicianship and performance

reviewText: I must say this DVD is great, the outfit she wears in the first songs is amazing, she looks great during the whole concert, though. She's a great performer, although she's not as good as Madonna. I hate comparing them, but both of them are good at what they do. I feel sorry for Madonna because she hasn't released many DVDs lately, I would like to see her Re-Invention Tour: Live in Lisbon on DVD, but I guess I'll have to wait, how long? She needs more DVDs, We don't even have either her Virgin Tour or her Blond Ambition Tour on DVD. Why??? I have no idea.Anyway, Kylie is a good performer, her voice is pretty good and her dancers are great too. It's a very good DVD, very fun concert. Thank you Kylie for releasing DVDs very often, I have them all. Thanks again.

reviewText: To her Aussie fans, Kylie is an adored princess. From the soap opera "Neighbours", through the PWL and indie phases and on to global success she has quinteseesentially remained the Aussie girl next door. Part of the joy of this DVD is watching just how much Kylie gets off on her audience. It is one of the most recipricol relationships I have ever witnessed in popular music. This is the concert tour where she had to cancel the Aussie leg of the tour as she found out she had breast cancer whilst she was at home in Melbourne. The DVD will not spoil the shows when she finally makes it home to Oz to perform the Showgirl tour next year-it merely makes us salivate for the real thing.From the opening number of her classic "Better the Devil You Know" through to the encores of "Especially For You" and "Love at First Sight" you get almost two hours of pure unadulterated pop perfection. Every song is celebrated with joy and every fan is catered for - whether you have adored her since "The Locomotion" or from her more recent "I Believe In You". Her singing is at its peak, the stage settings are superb and her band and dancers almost steal attention away from Ms Minogue.From all of your Aussie fans Kylie, we wish you well and can reassure you that when you do make it back home late next year you will be feted as the Pop Queen you truly are.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Kylie Minogue continues to become an endearing and talented live performer, which was clear in previous DVD releases such as Live in Sydney (2001) and Live in Manchester (2002).  This release opts more for the camp spectacle of the Sydney tour than the stylish elegance of the futuristic Manchester performance, so your enjoyment of this DVD may depend on how much you enjoy the campy side of Kylie.Certainly no expense has been spared for this concert; in fact, this is probably Kylie's most elaborate - and expensive - show ever.  It has many enjoyable moments, including "Giving You Up"; the energetic "Smiley-Kylie" medley; the beautifully choreographed "In Denial" sequence; a sexy "Red Blooded Woman" performance; and a faithful version of "I Should Be So Lucky" which adheres to its original Europop version.Kylie's in great voice, and commands the stage well, although there is a touch of sadness watching the show knowing that Kylie would shortly be diagnosed with breast cancer.This DVD will undoubtedly please Kylie fans looking for an upbeat, high-energy show. If you haven't paid much attention to Kylie, this is a good start since she covers every phase of her career.
summary: Another dazzling show from Smiley Kylie
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a new US Kylie fan, and have slowly been collecting her CD's and DVD's. I absolutely cannot believe she has not been embraced in the US. Only her gay fans know how great she is (so cutting edge).I took the advice of a previous post and ordered this DVD through the Canadian website at the fastest shipping possible...still saved $$$ over buying it in the US at Super Saver shipping.The show she put on beats out everything she has ever done. Kylie keeps topping herself over and over, getting more and more creative and running her image and business like a pro. I wish folks would stop comparing her to Madonna. Although similar, Kylie is an artist unto herself.Everything is here, plus some glimpses of things that may have slipped by new Kylie fan's eyes. The "Smiley Kylie" section is a personal favorite, as it sounds a bit like "Hits + 1", only better produced. The musicians and the arranger did a great job making old hits sound new and interesting (even though, as is, they are interesting). The energy that was on the "Live in Sydney" DVD but lacking on the "Fever" tour are back again on "Showgirl", plus some.Song after song, this DVD does NOT dissapoint. The extras are worth the money alone. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for everyone...Kylie fans and newbies alike.
summary: If you liked "Live in Sydney" and were dissapointed in "Fever Tour", you'll LOVE this DVD

reviewText: Kylie Minogue is another of those international stars that is somehow virtually unknown in the United States. Fortunately her DVDs are available in Region 1 format.  This show pulls out all the stops and covers all of her best songs.  Despite a risque troop of dancers including males in drag, she covers her material with style and grace in a way that appeals to all ages.  Despite her international fame Kylie remains humble and connects with her audience.  The only North American female pop star that comes close is Madonna.
summary: Kylie Minogue - As great as ever
